SmaxN 0.2
  • Reference

    Compute the biggest SmaxN for all the possible path of a given timestep

    recursive.paths.Rd

    This function computes all the paths beggining with a given timestep of the first camera and return the highest SmaxN found on those path.

    recursive.paths(T, frame_possible_df, n, path_df, SmaxN_small_UI)

    Arguments

    T

    a numerical value referring to the number of the row of the abundance dataframe studied (timestep)

    frame_possible_df

    a dataframe which represents the frame of possible for the studied timestep. Computed using the frame.possible function.

    n

    a numerical value refering to the studied camera on which the function searches new values

    path_df

    a dataframe with value/camera_name/timestep information of cells already on the path

    SmaxN_small_UI

    a numeric value refering to the highest pseudo SmaxN found on the lowest intervals.

    Value

    the highest SmaxN value found on all the possble path given the studied timestep and the frame of possible.

    Examples

    
abund_df <- data.frame("A" = c(3,8,3,3,3,3,3), "B" = c(0,4,2,2,1,8,3), 
"C" = c(0,0,0,9,1,1,1), "D" = c(1,0,0,0,3,3,3))

time_df <- data.frame("A" = c(0,4,4,3), "B" = c(4,0,2,2), 
                      "C" = c(4,2,0,2), "D" = c(3,2,2,0))
rownames(time_df) <- c("A", "B", "C", "D")

cam_order <- cam.order(time_df)

abund_df <- abund_df[, as.vector(unlist(cam_order))]

frame_possible_df <- frame.possible(T = 4, time_df, abund_df)

n <- 4

path_df <- data.frame("value" = c(0, 4, 0), 
                      "cam_nm" = c("D", "B", "C"), 
                      "timestep" =  c(4, 2, 2))
path_df[4, ] <- rep(NA, 3)
                      
SmaxN_small_UI <- 10

SmaxN <- recursive.paths(T = 4, frame_possible_df, n, path_df, SmaxN_small_UI) 
#> [1] "n = 4"
#> [1] "n = 4"
#> [1] "Still some possible cells for cam 4"
#> Error in next.possible(max_bloc = path_df, next_possible = cells_coord,     time_df): object 'time_df' not found
